intro: Monsonia keniensis, commonly known as the Kenyan monsonia, is a flowering plant native to Kenya. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that help reduce water loss. Monsonia keniensis is adapted to thrive in regions with low rainfall and high temperatures.
